title: WTB - Multiple Tougher Graded Commons, HOF's and SL's

posts.post_title: WTB - Multiple Tougher Graded Commons, HOF's and SL's
posts.post_content:
Want list updated in most recent post

[STRIKE]Hi all, as I'm getting closer to my 520 number, I'm looking to fill in some holes, and would be interested if anyone has any of the following in PSA or SGC 2-4 range.

Got a bunch off my original list, updated for what I still need

George Brown Cubs
[STRIKE]Joe Doyle[/STRIKE]

PM sent.

Bump, been able to get a bunch off of my original list, let me know if anyone has any of these available.  Prices are what I'd like to pay, but not set in stone.  Willing to pay a little more for cards that present strong for the grade.
Bump
Bump
pm sent

bumpity bump.

Got a few more off of my original list, still need these though.  Please send me a PM if you have one that you are looking to move (graded, 2-4 range, either PSA or SGC is fine).
Sending PM
Reposted in newer post
Bump
I got an Overall port in a 3. Are you only looking to buy or anything for trade at the moment? Thank you.

[quote name="wazoo" post=2049750]I got an Overall port in a 3. Are you only looking to buy or anything for trade at the moment? Thank you.[/QUOTE]

Hi - Thanks for the post.  I'm primarily looking to buy, but I do have a few duplicates in 2-3 range.  If there is something specific you are looking for, let me know and I can check.

Bump with updated list below:

After 8+ years on the journey (began 4 years before I even started this thread) I'm down to the last 4 to get to 520. I've had a couple of close calls on some of these last 4 in auctions recently, and I am getting a little antsy to close this goal out.  I'm going to add approximate prices I'd be willing to pay below, but would pay a little higher for something with nice eye appeal for the grade, and a little lower for worse eye appeal. 

Looking for the below graded (PSA or SGC), and preferably somewhere in the 2-3 range.

Walter Johnson Portrait - 
Lajoie w/ Bat - 

Looking for the below in a nicer eye appeal PSA or SGC graded 1/1.5 (or possibly up to a 2 on the high end of my range below for the green Cobb).

Cobb Portrait Green -  
O'Hara St. Louis - 

If you have anything that fits in these ranges that you'd be interested in selling, please let me know!
PM sent on WaJo Portrait

Another bump, progress has been slow the past year, after almost 9 years, getting antsy and want to close this journey out.  

Have bought a lot of cards off this board over the years, still looking for the following 4 cards:

Walter Johnson Portrait
Lajoie w/ Bat 
Cobb Green Portrait
O'Hara St. Louis

PSA or SGC graded

Looking for a decent eye-appeal 1 or 1.5 on the Green Cobb and O'Hara, and then, anything in the 2-3 range on WaJo Portrait and Lajoie w/Bat.

Not looking for a steal, anything close to market/recent comps and I'll take it!
Sending Message on a Nice SGC 1.5 Green Cobb

Another bump as it has been a few months.

Still looking for the following 4 cards:

Walter Johnson Portrait
Lajoie w/ Bat
Cobb Green Portrait
O'Hara St. Louis

I know this is a bit of a timing play based around whether someone happens to have one available at the time of these bumps, but I'm really not looking for any sort of deal on these, just something reasonably close to recent comps for similar condition cards would work.

There have been some I missed at auction that I would have paid more than they went for if I had seen them, and on a few occasions, I have ended up as the direct under-bidder.  Just haven't quite been able to connect on any of the 4.

On Johnson and Lajoie w/bat, ideally in the 2ish range on those, on Cobb Green and O'hara St. Louis, probably close to the 1 or 1.5 range, but could go up to a 2 if not cost prohibitive.

Preferably no heavy stains, severe off-centering, missing pieces of the card, distracting markings, or really bad creasing through the face on a portrait card, etc.  But, any other sort of normal wear consistent with a 100+ year old piece of carboard is all good.  

Thank you for your consideration
